plugins.name: Figma Image Compressor (free)
plugins.description:
The fastest way to compress (& speed up) your Figma Pages and Documents (and downloaded .fig files)!


With Figma Image Compressor, you simply open it up, it finds all images in your Figma Page, and gives you the option to compress them all at once. This includes resizing them (when it's safe to do so) to make your Figma Pages and Documents much smaller. More details:


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required.
  2. You can compress as many images, Figma Pages, or Figma Documents as you'd like (no paid license required).
  3. Figma Document Compressor will automatically resize images when it's safe to do so.


üîí Safe & Secure:

  1. The images never leave your computer (or Figma). This means Figma Image Compressor is the safest way to compress & resize your images.


üéâ Benefits:

  1. Makes your Figma Documents load faster!
  2. Makes exporting SVGs with image data in them much smaller.
  3. Makes exporting JPEGs and PNGs much faster.
  4. Makes exporting .fig files much smaller (up to 80% smaller)
  5. Compresses the following formats: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WEBP, HEIC, GIF
  6. Will resize images when it's safe.
  7. Will convert PNGs only when they don't contain any transparency.


ü§î More:

  1. Just open Figma Image Compressor: it'll search for images right away
  2. Select the images you want to compress.
  3. Press the blue button in the bottom-left.
  4. That's it!


üîó References:

  1. Thanks for Fengyuan Chen for building compressorjs.


üõü Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is ;)

plugins.name: global style to code
plugins.description:
Global Style To Code enables developers to quickly convert global styles (text, paint, and effect) to code. 


All support styles

  • text styles
  • paint styles
  • effect styles


Variable Options

you can convert styles to code in several ways

  • Javascript object style
  • CSS class style (only in paint style)
  • CSS variable style
  • SCSS mixin style
  • SCSS variable style(only in paint style)


if you choose to convert paint style, there are options for color expression

  • RGBA code (default)
  • HEX code (ex. #EEFF00)
  • HSL code (ex. hsl(240, 100%, 50%))


How to use

  1. turn on this plugin in your figma file
  2. check styles that you want to get
  3. check export options
  4. copy and paste on your code!


Got questions?

please contact me :)


If you like this plugin, visit my repository and press star button!

https://github.com/YumYumNyang/yummy-figma-plugin

accepted.name: yumyumnyang
accepted.description: I'm Hyewon(a.k.a YumYumNyang) Creator, Frontend developer.

plugins.tagline: 'Global Style To Code' enables developers to quickly convert global styles to code.

plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Introducing the Accessibility Checker by UX Mate, your go-to tool for seamless color accessibility checks right within Figma!


With the Accessibility Checker, brought to you by UX Mate, evaluating color contrast in your designs has never been easier. Say goodbye to the hassle of navigating to external websites or tools ‚Äì now, you can assess color accessibility directly from your Figma canvas.


Here's how it works: simply select two objects in your design featuring solid colors you want to test. With just a click on 'Check Contrast,' the Accessibility Checker will analyze the selected colors and provide immediate feedback on their contrast ratio.


Not only does the Accessibility Checker save you time and effort, but it also ensures that your designs meet accessibility standards. By quickly identifying whether your color combinations pass AA and AAA standards, you can make informed decisions to enhance the accessibility of your designs.


Experience the convenience and efficiency of the Accessibility Checker by UX Mate today, and elevate the accessibility of your Figma projects with confidence!


Join us on YouTube
plugins.tagline: Now Color Contrast Checking is on Fingertips

plugins.name: AI Palette
plugins.description:
• The Figma plugin to generate a color palette would allow users to easily create a set of colors to use in their designs. The plugin would provide various functionalities to generate different types of color palettes based on user requirements.
  • When a user selects the plugin, it would open a dialog box that provides various options for generating the color palette. Users can either choose to create a new color palette or edit an existing one.
  • Once a user selects the option to create a new color palette, they can specify the number of colors they want to include and the color range they want to generate the colors from. The plugin could provide different options to generate colors, such as random, monochromatic, complementary, triadic, analogous, or shades of a specific color.
  • After generating the color palette, the plugin would display the colors in a grid format with the color codes provided for each color. The user can also adjust the color codes or reorder the colors as per their preference.
  • The plugin could also provide additional features such as the ability to save the color palette as a Figma style or export it as a CSS file, making it easier for developers to use the colors in their code.
  • Overall, the Figma plugin to generate a color palette would simplify the process of creating and managing color palettes, saving users valuable time and effort in the design process.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create stunning color palettes with our Figma plugin.

plugins.name: Leading Trim
plugins.description:
Trim your text elements, removing space above capital letters and below the baseline. Make text behave the same as every other element in your layout.


This plugin works by nesting and offsetting text elements within frames.


To achieve the same behaviour in a browser, check out Capsize which this plugin uses internally.


The code for this plugin is open source and available on GitHub: https://github.com/markdalgleish/figma-leading-trim.

plugins.name: Visual Center
plugins.description:
Find the visual center of any vector shape.


The plugin uses two methods for determining the visual center depending on the shape.


  1. For triangles the plugin will find the centroid to determine visual center.
  2. For vector shapes with more than three vertices the plugin uses the center of the smallest enclosing circle (https://www.nayuki.io/page/smallest-enclosing-circle).


üëâ Usage


  1. Select one or more vector shapes and run the plugin
  2. A guide layer will be added to the page and grouped together with the selected shape.


üëâ Supported Node Types


  • VECTOR
  • STAR
  • RECTANGLE
  • POLYGON
  • ELLIPSE


ü§î Edge cases


This plugin is not a bulletproof solution to finding the exact visual center. There are still cases in which manual alignment is necessary.

plugins.name: Iconiex - icons, illustrations, and emojis. A highly enhanced Figma plugin with 500+ icon packs.
plugins.description:
Iconiex surpassed 1.4 million+ downloads on mobile and web platforms üéâ


About Iconiex

Grounded with enthusiastic designers, Iconiex is an open-source Figma plugin designed for designing icons. It offers designers a comprehensive library of 140,000+ high-quality icons seamlessly integrated into the design workflows.


üî• Popular Icons & Massive Sets

With over 400+ icon sets, you can choose your desired icon for your work. Here are some of the popular sets used by community people across multiple platforms:

  1. Settings Icons
  2. Dashboard Icons
  3. Back Icons
  4. Download Icons
  5. User Icons
  6. Menu Icons
  7. Home Icons
  8. Edit Icons & more...


‚úÖ Features

  1. User-friendly
  2. Search & sort by styles and categories
  3. Easy customization
  4. Feedback & support
  5. High-quality icons
  6. Premium plan for custom icons


üìå How to use

  1. Go to the Figma community and search for Iconiex.
  2. Install the plugin.
  3. And there you go! Just drag and drop your icons and have fun üòé


License

  1. Open-source license: free to use.
  2. For custom paid icons, please Contact us
  3. View full license documentation here


Pricing

  1. Currently, free and premium plans are available.
  2. For premium, the Pro & Team plan is on the run.
  3. We are also running promotional packages; to know more, please visit Iconiex


Feedback & Support

  1. We are 24/7 dedicated to your support.
  2. For more assistance, please contact us
  3. View full support documentation here


Testimonials

Our clients speak for us. We have 100+ successful projects across multiple platforms. Some of them are:

  1. William James - Their icon sets are user-friendly and easy to use. Covered total aspects of our project and delivered within time.
  2. Aarushi Agarwal - Used corporate icons of Iconiex. Customization is super easy. We also get custom icons according to our request.
  3. Emma Olivia, senior designer - I used Iconiex icons, and I must say, they're better than the others. Super friendly support from the support team.
  4. GraphyPix - We used bold icons for our niche marketing. Later we shifted to more styles to match our project. No hassle at all!
  5. Nishat Tasnim - As a professional designer, I prefer customizable icons with all aspects, and Iconiex delivered that to me. Such a lifesaver!


FAQs


1. How do I install the plugin in Figma?

Answer:

To install the Iconiex plugin in Figma, follow these steps:

  1. Open Figma and go to the "Community" tab in the left sidebar.
  2. Search for "Iconiex" in the search bar.
  3. Click on the "Install" button next to the Icon plugin.
  4. Once installed, you can access the plugin by right-clicking on the canvas and selecting "Plugins" > "Iconiex" or by using the keyboard shortcut (Shift + Command/Ctrl + P) and typing "Iconiex."


2. Can I customize the icons provided by the plugin?

Answer:

Yes, you can customize the icons provided by the Iconiex plugin. After selecting an icon, you can adjust its size, color, and positioning just like any other vector object in Figma. Additionally, you can modify the icon's properties using Figma's editing tools, such as changing fill colors, adding shadows, or adjusting strokes to fit your design needs.


3. Does the plugin support multiple icon sets?

Answer:

Yes, the Iconiex plugin supports multiple icon sets, giving you access to a wide range of styles and categories. You can browse through various icon libraries within the plugin, such as duotone, bulk, outline, and filled icons. To switch between icon sets, simply use the search or filter options within the plugin to find the set that best suits your design project.


üöÄ Follow our website and social media to get the latest updates


Created by

Iconiex

The interface imitates the native Figma UI so should be intuitive and easy to use.


The plugin comes with some default values which can be modified in Settings.


How to use:

  1. Run the plugin
  2. Select 1 or multiple layers and use the predefined tokens
  3. OR go into settings and define your own tokens.

plugins.name: Formalist: Progressive Design Linter
plugins.description:
QA for your designs! Spend less on checking, earn more on automation. Save from 3 to 10 hours monthly on finding issues in your design.


In case there is a need to implement the rules that are not a part of the plugin:

We can develop a personalized version of Formalist meeting these standards. Let us know if we can add custom checks for your needs: write a letter to support@formalistplugin.com.

Note: you should subscribe ¬´Pro¬ª‚Äé or ¬´Organisation¬ª plan to get this feature.


Formalist looks for common mistakes in Figma designs

The idea behind it is simple, and based on what software engineers call a linter: The plugin runs through a list of rules, checking the Figma file for errors. If the designer has, for example, forgotten to name layers, use Figma styles, or fractional coordinates, the plugin will hunt them, find them, and help fix them.


In free mode you will have these checks for 15 free scans:

  • The object doesn't use the style in the font, fill, stroke, effects
  • Fonts less than 12px
  • Fractional coordinates and size
  • The default name of the object, property, or variant
  • Something's wrong with the component or the instance
  • The parent component was deleted
  • Too much Auto-layouts
  • Missing ".base" in component's name
  • Empty auto-layout in a component
  • Using different colors or fonts in the same text box


After 15 scans only these checks will be available:

  • Fonts less than 12px
  • Fractional coordinates
  • Fractional size
  • Default names


Try out the demo project to learn more about plugin!

Note: duplicate the file from the link above to your drafts to try the plugin


Stay tuned for the updates.


Looking for those, who made this? Here we are:

Nikita Bryuzgin

Danila Mikhaltsov

plugins.name: Bolt
plugins.description:
An all-in-one plugin


## About


Shows some information about plugin


## Auto layout all (multiple)


Adds auto-layout frames around all selected elements without grouping them under one frame.


## Frame all (multiple)


Add frames to all selected elements


## Align along baseline


Align children of all selected auto-layout frames to baseline.


## Flip Colors


Flips the selection colors


- Flip the two colours in your selection. Selection must contain 2 colors only to use this feature


## Detach Component


Converts a component to a frame. It's similar to to detach instance but on the component.


## Unlock All Children


Unlock all the children in your selection


## Lock All Children


Lock all the children in your selection


## Reset Background


For all the pages in your figma file


- The page background is set to #1E1E1E ‚¨õ if you are using dark mode

- The page background is set to #F5F5F5 ‚¨úÔ∏è if you are using light mode


## Use Current Background For Other Pages


- Picks the background of current page and applies the same to all the other pages in your figma file


## Reset Prototype Background


For all the pages in your figma file, sets the prototype background to #000000 ‚¨õ


## Scaffold


**From Preset**


**View/Update Presets**


## Rename Page


Rename current page with keyboard from quick actions.


Enter new name of your choice or select from the suggestions


Suggestions are from presets


## Search Pages


Navigate to a page in your figma file with keyboard from quick actions.


Enter page name or choose from the suggestions


## Delete Other Pages


Delete all the other pages except the current one in your figma file.

Deleted by mistake? Simply perform undo.


## Collapse Layers


**Collapse All** - Collapse all the objects of current page in the layers panel

**Collapse Selection** - Collapse all the objects and children of your selection in the layers panel


## Expand Layers


**Expand All** - Expand all the objects of current page in the layers panel

**Expand Selection** - Expand all the objects and children of your selection in the layers panel

plugins.name: RTL PLZ Handoff
plugins.description:
This plugin is no longer needed. Install the RTL PLZ plugin and use the "reset to original text" command to upgrade and reset your old texts.

Currently, in Figma If an RTL text is readable to you, that will be unreadable for developers or users that want to copy the original text. This plugin makes a big frame over your document and duplicates text layers with the original text, so when the developer tries to select a text layer, the replica layer with the original text will be selected.

How to use: Select some layer with RTL text (that was written with the RTL PLZ plugin) and run the plugin.

Layers that have LTR text or are written with other tools are currently being skipped.

61523.description:
This plugin is no longer needed. Install the RTL PLZ plugin and use the "reset to original text" command to upgrade and reset your old texts.

Currently, in Figma If an RTL text is readable to you, that will be unreadable for developers or users that want to copy the original text. This plugin makes a big frame over your document and duplicates text layers with the original text, so when the developer tries to select a text layer, the replica layer with the original text will be selected.

How to use: Select some layer with RTL text (that was written with the RTL PLZ plugin) and run the plugin.

Layers that have LTR text or are written with other tools are currently being skipped.

plugins.name: Data Roulette
plugins.description:
Insert randomized data from Google Sheets into tagged layers in your designs. Supports text, images, and colors.


How to use

  1. Create a public Google Sheet. The headings for each column in your sheet is then used to tag layers in Figma.
  2. Run the Data Roulette plugin. Create a new data set and paste your public sheet url in
  3. Tag layers in Figma with column titles prefixed with #
  4. Select layers and click "Insert Data" to get random data inserted based on the tags in your selection


Tags

  1. Tag layers with using # followed by the column title. Example: #Description for a column titled 'Description' in Google Sheets
  2. Tags can contain spaces. Example: #User Name


Data Sets

  1. Create multiple Data Sets to separate and organize data from multiple spreadsheets


Combine Tags

  1. Combine tags using +. Example: #First Name + #Last Name
  2. Insert a text value and color the text using this method. Example: #Comment + #Comment Color


Images

  1. Add urls to images (must be https) in your sheet. Tagging shape layers with image url data will apply the linked images as fills.
  2. Supports base64 data urls (e.g. data:image/png;base64...)


Colors

  1. Add colors as Hex, RGB, or RGBA values in your sheet. Tagging a shape or text layer will apply colors as a fills.


Grouping

Data is grouped by row, so for instance if you have Firstname and Lastname columns, filling data into tagged layers will pair the appropriate values for that user entry. If you want to separate data use another data set, or create multiple sheets within a single Google Sheet for each type of related data.

accepted.name: Hamish
accepted.description: Hey I'm Hamish ‚Äî a designer & developer working @Qwilr

plugins.tagline: Insert randomized data from Google Sheets into tagged layers in your designs.

plugins.name: CoShuffler
plugins.description:
A tool for randomly assigning colors to a selection of objects from a chosen color palette!


Usage

Quickly apply an assortment of colors to large selection of objects.

  • Create cool, complex patterns for backgrounds!
  • Make color iterations of logos, buttons, etc!
  • Mock up data visualizations without the hassle!


Instructions:

  1. Install CoShuffler by pressing the "Install" button in the top-right corner of this page.
  2. In your figma file, open the CoShuffler by right clicking on the canvas -> Plugins -> CoShuffler
  3. Set your palette: Select a group of objects which contain your desired color palette, and then click "Set colors".
  4. Select your objects: Once your palette is set, select one or more objects that you want to shuffle
  5. Start Shuffling: Click "GO!" to start shuffling between colors in your palette!
  6. (Optional) On the "info" page, choose whether to enable or disable strokes and fills from being adjusted by the CoShuffler.


Constraints:

  • Currently, CoShuffler will ignore groups, frames, and components. If you want to shuffle objects in groups, either directly select the objects or ungroup them.
  • Image and gradient fills will be ignored.
  • If your object has multiple fills, CoShuffler will only change the top fill. It won't affect opacity settings of fills either.


If you have any complaints, concerns, or want to share what you're making with CoShuffler, you can reach me via email or Instagram. Cheers, and happy shuffling! ü•≥

accepted.name: Andrew Goodridge
accepted.description: Design üçû and Development üßà

plugins.tagline: A tool for randomly assigning colors to a selection of objects from a chosen color palette!

plugins.name: UI Stories (Assets Showcase Generator)
plugins.description:
UI Stories Plugin is a showcase generator that streamlines the design process by organizing and documenting assets.


How It Works:


‚Äì Flexible Selection: Begin by selecting any component, component set, component instance, or design element like frames or shapes. The plugin automatically identifies the related component sets or components linked to your selection and displays a list for you to choose which components to document.


‚Äì Comprehensive Documentation: If no specific selection is made, the plugin will catalog all component sets and components throughout your file. It may take longer if your file includes numerous components with multiple variations.


The plugin is designed to efficiently handle large datasets to prevent freezing during rendering. However, if rendering all showcases becomes overly time-consuming, consider using the component-by-component rendering option for a quicker and more manageable process.


‚Äì Theme-Specific Documentation: For files containing multiple themes, the plugin generates themed documentation frames. For 'Dark' themes, components are displayed against a black background, while other themes use a light gray background.


Default background values are customizable (e.g., _DemoPage-darkBackgroundForComponentsDemo as #251F1F for dark themes and _DemoPage-lightBackgroundForComponentsDemo as #E9E8E8 for others).


You can adjust these backgrounds, including setting them to transparent, to suit your project needs. Once you modify these color settings, the plugin will remember your preferences and apply these settings in all subsequent operations, ensuring consistency across your documentation process.


‚Äì Rendering Options: You can choose to display the component showcases directly on the active page, where a new frame will appear at the top of your layer list. Alternatively, opt for documentation on a newly created page, where the plugin will generate a timestamped page at the bottom of your page list.


‚Äì Detailed Property Display: The plugin renders a table for properties that have multiple values, ensuring detailed visual documentation. Properties with only a single value are neatly listed below the table, providing a clear and organized overview. At the end of each table, a timestamp indicates when the showcase was rendered. Additionally, if a component has a description, it will also be displayed.


‚Äì Testing your components: For components that lack variants or have errors, I display "N/A" in the cell instead of the component, allowing you to easily test for missing variants. Keep in mind that the absence of some variants is normal, as they may not always be necessary.


As a testing tool, you can also change the background color in all cells simultaneously, visually testing how all your components and their variants appear against different backgrounds. This feature enhances the ability to ensure visual consistency across your designs.


Key Features:

‚Äì Generate Overview in Seconds: Automatically generate detailed views of all components and component sets within your Figma file. Whether you select specific components or document the entire file, the plugin provides a visual inventory on a single page.


‚Äì Theme-Specific Rendering: The plugin facilitates rendering components against different themes, making it easy to test and compare visual consistency across various backgrounds.


‚Äì Efficiency Boost: Save valuable design time by generating demonstrations for components directly within Figma. This feature helps you understand how your assets function, identify missing elements, and provide clear visualizations that save development time‚Äîensuring design integrity.


‚Äì Dynamic Updates: Re-run the plugin at any time to refresh your documentation as your designs evolve, ensuring your component overviews always reflect the latest changes.


Coming Soon:

‚Äì Smart grouping of non-component sets

‚Äì Conversion of all interface blocks into components

‚Äì Extended inventory capabilities, allowing inventorying variables and local styles for enhanced design system management and documentation within Figma

accepted.name: Olga Stogova
accepted.description: Experienced Full Stack Engineer Specializing in TypeScript/React and Advanced Interface Development

plugins.tagline: Create detailed showcases of your Figma components' properties

plugins.name: Source Foundation
plugins.description:
Bootstrap design system foundation in a few simple steps.


  1. Source Foundation Demo -> Watch onYouTube (11:10)
  2. Source Foundation Deep Dive -> Watch on You Tube (9:43)
  3. How it works ‚Üí Read on Medium


Colours


Source Foundation generates well-balanced and accessible palettes for light or dark modes. Each palette includes neutrals, brand, semantics and eleven beautiful accent colours to work with. And it is WCAG 2.2 compliant. 


There is a playground file with design examples and extended documentation on how it works.


Learn more about the colour system ‚Üí


Typography


For typography there are tree scales:

  1. Major third
  2. Minor third
  3. Major second


And three base font sizes

  1. Compact (13/16): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (15/20): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (17/24): Touch oriented UIs


Spacing


There are four pre-calculated spacing scales:

  1. Compact (16): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (20): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (24): Max negative space
  4. Touch (16): Optimised for touch devices


Radii


There are three pre-calculated radii scales

  1. Compact (4): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (6): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (8): Touch oriented UIs

plugins.tagline: Design system foundation generator. Generate colours, spacing, radii and typography variables

136447.name: Source Foundation
136447.description:
Bootstrap design system foundation in a few simple steps.


  1. Source Foundation Demo -> Watch onYouTube (11:10)
  2. Source Foundation Deep Dive -> Watch on You Tube (9:43)
  3. How it works ‚Üí Read on Medium


Colours


Source Foundation generates well-balanced and accessible palettes for light or dark modes. Each palette includes neutrals, brand, semantics and eleven beautiful accent colours to work with. And it is WCAG 2.2 compliant. 


There is a playground file with design examples and extended documentation on how it works.


Learn more about the colour system ‚Üí


Typography


For typography there are tree scales:

  1. Major third
  2. Minor third
  3. Major second


And three base font sizes

  1. Compact (13/16): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (15/20): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (17/24): Touch oriented UIs


Spacing


There are four pre-calculated spacing scales:

  1. Compact (16): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (20): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (24): Max negative space
  4. Touch (16): Optimised for touch devices


Radii


There are three pre-calculated radii scales

  1. Compact (4): Suits for native desktop applications
  2. Base (6): Well balanced size that works for majority of use cases
  3. Large (8): Touch oriented UIs

plugins.description:
The use of plug-ins in past Photoshop works can now be transferred to Figma.


Preparation work:

Please use Photoshop plug-in to convert PSD files to Json and PNG.


Step 1. Select the JSON file and load the Psd settings

>> After loading the Json file, use the icon according to the description size and position.


Step 2. Select the PNG file and load the PNG

>> Complete the point replacement image specified in the Json file

plugins.name: Blob Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Create a (free) blob in 2-clicks!


Blob Maker does exactly what it sounds like: it helps you make a blob! This is useful when you're designing sites, apps or marketing material, and you need a soft, creative shape to loosen the feeling.


üëãüèª First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All settings (and accessing your history) are free


üé® Choose a color:

This is a simple one: choose the color of the blob, as well as the color of the stroke / border / outline.


‚ö™Ô∏è Choose how complicated the blob looks:

Use the slider to add more "points" along the blob. The more points, the more complicated the blob will look. The fewer points, the less complicated the blob will look.


üìè Choose the stroke width:

Also simple: use the slider to make the stroke bigger or thinner (or none at all).


ü§î More:

  1. Click on "Insert Blob" to add it to your design
  2. You can also click "Regenerate" to get a new random blob
  3. View the history of all previously used blobs


üõü Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is

plugins.name: Smartling
plugins.description:
Without leaving Figma, you can submit prototypes for professional, machine or pseudo translation to get the gist for what the localized environment will look like before you put your ‚Äúpencil down‚Äù on a project.


When you start translating and localizing your content as soon as the design prototypes are available, the entire process for shipping new product gets faster. Smartling‚Äôs localization plugin for Figma seamlessly connects your designers with Smartling‚Äôs translation service in just one click.


You prototype user experiences in English because that‚Äôs the primary language of your product or digital environment. You check to see if text fits within buttons, how layouts change with different devices and make design decisions based on your preferred user experience. Why not do this for your global user base, too?


Product Documentation:


Install - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360048715133-Figma-Plugin-Installation-and-


Setup Pseudotranslation - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047993254-Pseudotranslation-in-


FigmaSubmit for Translation - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047994174-Submit-Translations-to-


SmartlingDownload or Apply Translations in Figma - https://help.smartling.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047999554-Apply-Translations-in-Figma
